marketNews.title: US Stock Market Plummets Under Recession Concerns
marketNews.content: The US stock market continued its weakening, with the Nasdaq index down 4.8% week-over-week, the S&P 500 down 3.6% week-over-week, and the DJIA down 2.6% week-over-week on Tuesday (11 March). This decline extends the weakening trend that has been ongoing for the past two weeks, driven by investor worries about a potential US recession due to the trade war. Mark Zandi, Chief Economist at Moody's Analytics, told ABC News that the firm has now raised the probability of a US recession to 35%. In response to the US market decline, US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday (11 March) that the public cannot only watch the stock market, a statement contrary to his usual tendency to use market rallies as proof of his success. Trump also warned of possible turmoil during the "transition period" of his administration, because his government aims to do "something big" to bring wealth back into the US. Trump has repeatedly vacillated on implementing his tariff policy, creating global market uncertainty. Most recently, Trump on Tuesday (11 March) threatened to double import tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminium to 50% after the province of Ontario announced a plan to levy an additional fee on electricity shipped to the US. The tariff-doubling proposal was cancelled by Trump only a few hours after it was announced, following the cancellation of Ontario's authority to impose the extra electricity fee. Meanwhile, the European Union announced on Wednesday (12 March) that the region will soon impose counter-tariffs on US imports worth 28 billion US dollars. This move follows the US government's implementation of a 25% import tariff on steel and aluminium commodities on the same day. The EU said it will end the suspension of US import tariffs for the 2018-2020 period on 1 April 2025 and will apply full US import tariffs on 13 April 2025, but remains open to negotiations because higher tariffs would not benefit anyone. Key Takeaway: The risk of a US recession could pressure the global economy and negatively affect Indonesia's trade balance through lower exports. Conversely, a weakening US economy could give the Federal Reserve more room to cut US interest rates, which could be followed by a reduction of the BI Rate by Bank Indonesia. The Fed rate-cut outlook has recently improved, with analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool showing the probability of a US rate cut of more than 50 basis points by the end of 2025 rising to 65.8% today from 60.9% a week earlier. Additionally, a deteriorating US economic outlook could trigger capital outflows from the US to other countries offering better growth prospects.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's January 2025 Fiscal Deficit Reaches 0.1% of GDP
marketNews.content: Business reported that the fiscal deficit for January 2025 reached 0.1% of GDP (versus a surplus of 0.16% of GDP in January 2024, with the 2025 budget target of a 2.53% deficit). The data were released on the Ministry of Finance website on Wednesday (12 March), but the document was no longer available on the website by midday, although the media managed to obtain a screenshot of the document. According to the screenshot compiled by Business, state revenue for January 2025 fell 28.3% year-over-year to 157.32 trillion rupiah, achieving only 5.24% of the 2025 budget target. State expenditure for January 2025 fell 1.9% year-over-year to 180.77 trillion rupiah, representing 4.99% of the 2025 budget target. The primary balance surplus narrowed to 10.61 trillion rupiah (versus a surplus of 65.25 trillion rupiah in January 2024, with the 2025 budget target of a 63.33 trillion rupiah deficit).

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani to Hold Fiscal Briefing on March 13
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Finance Minister Sri Mulyani will hold a briefing on the performance of the 2025 state budget on Thursday (13 March). The briefing will provide an update on the January 2025 budget performance, which is highly anticipated by the market amid the government's early-year budget reshuffle. The Ministry of Finance usually announces budget performance 2-3 weeks after the end of the previous month, but the briefing on the January 2025 performance has not yet taken place due to a tight schedule. On Wednesday (12 March), Business reported that the Ministry of Finance had uploaded the January 2025 performance document, but the document was no longer available later that day.

marketNews.title: Labor Ministry Proposes THR for Online Motorcycle Taxi Partners, Mentions GOTO
marketNews.content: Labor Minister Yassierli said on Tuesday (11 March) that the government proposes that the holiday allowance (THR) for online motorcycle-taxi (ojol) partners be at least 20% of the average net monthly income of partners over the past 12 months. He also stated that the government asks ride-hailing companies—including GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) and Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB)—to provide THR to ojol partners in cash, not in goods or other forms. Yassierli also ordered private companies and state-owned enterprises to disburse THR at least seven days before Ramadan 2025, with full payment and no installments.

marketNews.title: Parliament and Government Agree to Revise TNI Law Expanding Civilian Posts
marketNews.content: The government and the House of Representatives agreed on Tuesday (11 March) to revise Law No. 34/2004 concerning the Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI). The amendment discussion will focus on expanding civilian posts for TNI personnel from 10 ministries/agencies to 15 ministries/agencies. Defense Minister Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin said the draft amendment requires soldiers to resign from the TNI before taking civilian positions. According to DPR member TB Hasanuddin, the new draft differs from the previous draft that allowed active TNI personnel to fill any government position. The TNI law revision comes amid a trend of placing active and retired TNI officers in state-owned enterprises during President Prabowo Subianto's term. Earlier this month, Tempo reported that President Prabowo gathered hundreds of TNI colonels in Hambalang, West Java, for courses at SBM ITB, FEB UI, and Universitas Prasetya Mulya. These officers have the opportunity to assume managerial positions in BUMN and BUMD.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Forecasts Retail Sales Contraction of 0.5% YoY in February 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia estimates that retail sales will contract by 0.5% year-over-year in February 2025, although a month-over-month growth of 0.8% is projected as Ramadan and Idulfitri approach. The annual decline in February 2025 is expected to be driven by lower sales in food, beverages, and tobacco, while information and communication equipment, apparel sub-category, and motor vehicle fuel groups are expected to increase. Retail sales in January 2025 recorded a modest 0.5% year-over-year increase (versus +1.8% YoY in December 2024) but contracted 4.7% month-over-month (versus +5.9% MoM in December 2024). The monthly contraction aligns with post-holiday normalization after Christmas and New Year, causing most categories to contract except spare parts and accessories.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to Impose Anti-Dumping Duties on Nylon Imports from China, Thailand, and Taiwan
marketNews.content: The government will impose anti-dumping duties on nylon products from China, Thailand, and Taiwan starting 25 March 2025, based on the latest regulation issued on Wednesday (12 March). The duties will remain in effect for four years, with rates ranging from 1,254 to 31,510 rupiah per kilogram. The measure follows an investigation by the Indonesian Anti-Dumping Committee that found nylon imports from those countries caused losses to the domestic industry. Nylon is used in food packaging, pharmaceuticals, electronics, and textiles.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Approves New Board and Declares Final Dividend Yield of 2.7%
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: Shareholders of Bank Central Asia approved a proposal to replace the board of directors and commissioners on Wednesday (12 March). Gregory Hendra Lembong will become President Director, replacing Jahja Setiaatmadja, who will become President Commissioner. The change was announced by the company in February 2025. The General Meeting of Shareholders also approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 37 trillion rupiah, equivalent to a 67.4% dividend payout ratio (2023: 68.4%). This indicates a final dividend of 250 rupiah per share with a dividend yield of 2.7%, based on BBCA's closing price of 9,125 rupiah per share on Wednesday (12 March). The cum-date and payment date for the final dividend have not been announced. Previously, BBCA distributed an interim dividend for FY 2024 of 50 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Reports Positive Pro-Forma Adjusted EBITDA of 399 Billion Rupiah in Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: $GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia recorded a pro-forma adjusted EBITDA of 399 billion rupiah in the fourth quarter of 2024 (vs. 89 billion rupiah positive in Q4 2023 and 137 billion rupiah positive in Q3 2024). This result brought the adjusted EBITDA for 2024 to a positive 386 billion rupiah (2023: negative 2.3 trillion rupiah), surpassing the company's guidance that targeted breakeven. On a bottom-line basis, net loss narrowed to 1.1 trillion rupiah in Q4 2024 (vs. net loss of 80.4 trillion rupiah in Q4 2023, 655 billion rupiah in Q3 2024), resulting in a total net loss for 2024 of 3.1 trillion rupiah (2023: net loss of 87 trillion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: RATU Reports 2024 Net Profit of $13.9 Million, Down 43% YoY
tickerNews.content: $RATU: Raharja Energi Cepu posted a net profit of 13.9 million US dollars for 2024, a decline of 43% year-over-year. The profit drop was caused by a 74% year-over-year increase in cost of goods sold, which grew faster than revenue (which rose 23% YoY), reducing the gross margin to 38.9% (2023: 56.8%). The rise in cost of goods sold was mainly driven by an 81% YoY increase in lifting costs for oil and gas. Additionally, RATU's net profit in 2024 was pressured by weaker earnings from its associated entity in the Cepu block, which fell 18% YoY to 6.2 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: ASII Wholesales Decline in February 2025, Market Share Falls to 53.3%
tickerNews.content: $ASII: Astra International recorded wholesale vehicle sales of 38,546 units in February 2025, a decline of 6.5% year-over-year and an increase of 12% month-over-month, performing worse than the industry average (+2.2% YoY, +17% MoM). Consequently, ASII's market share fell to 53.3% in February 2025 (February 2024: 58.3%, January 2025: 55.8%). The February wholesale sales were supported by a 3.3% YoY (11% MoM) increase in Toyota+Lexus sales to 24,506 units, while Daihatsu sales dropped to 11,959 units (down 21% YoY, up 20% MoM). In the first two months of 2025, ASII's wholesale sales fell to 73,077 units, a decline of 7.8% YoY, with market share decreasing to 54.4% (2M24: 56.4%, 1M25: 55.8%).

tickerNews.title: PGAS Announces Potential Sale of Upstream Assets to Pertamina Hulu Energi
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: The President Director of Perusahaan Gas Negara, Arief Setiawan Handoko, said in a meeting with the House of Representatives on Wednesday (12 March) that the company is offering its upstream oil and gas business, PT Saka Energi Indonesia, to PT Pertamina Hulu Energi. Arief noted that the offer has not yet been accepted by Pertamina Hulu Energi. PT Saka Energi Indonesia currently manages 11 oil and gas blocks, comprising 6 operating blocks and 5 exploration blocks. Additionally, Arief stated that PGAS plans to divest the Muriah block—one of the blocks owned by PT Saka Energi Indonesia—although he did not provide further details. He explained that PGAS originally intended to return the block to the government because the contract expires in December 2026, but the company has recently received a buyer's offer.

tickerNews.title: DILD Targets 2 Trillion Rupiah Marketing Sales in 2025
tickerNews.content: $DILD: The Director of Intiland Development, Archied Noto Pradono, said the company targets marketing sales of 2 trillion rupiah in 2025, equal to the 2024 target and 25% higher than the 2024 realization of 1.6 trillion rupiah. Kontan reported that DILD previously indicated a possible conservative strategy for 2025, considering weakened purchasing power among the middle class. DILD allocated a capex of 120 billion rupiah in 2025 (2024 capex: 1 trillion rupiah) to consolidate several industrial land areas, such as in Batang, Central Java, and Ngoro, East Java.

tickerNews.title: RMKE Projects 62.5% YoY Net Profit Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: $RMKE: RMK Energy's President Director, Vincent Saputra, said the company targets a net profit growth of 62.5% year-over-year in 2025, reaching 446.7 billion rupiah, with revenue growth of 58.5% YoY to 3.9 trillion rupiah. Operationally, RMKE aims for a 24.1% YoY increase in coal loading to 11.2 million tons in 2025, and a 35.4% YoY rise in coal sales to 3.8 million tons. Vincent said the targets are supported by two new customers and ongoing projects, such as the construction of a hauling road connected to PT Bukit Asam ($PTBA) operations, a new container yard at the Gunung Megang loading station in Muara Enim, and increased capacity at the Simpang loading station in South Sumatra.

tickerNews.title: SMLE Shares Sold by PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo for 8.5 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $SMLE: PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo, the controlling shareholder of Sinergi Multi Lestarindo, sold 100 million SMLE shares at a price of 85 rupiah per share on 5 March 2025. The total transaction value reached 8.5 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Sinergi Asia Corporindo's ownership in SMLE decreased from 77.42% to 73.12%.

tickerNews.title: FORU Shares Sold by IMR Asia Holding, Ownership Decreases to 76.81%
tickerNews.content: $FORU: Fortune Indonesia's controlling shareholder, IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd., sold 2.4 million FORU shares at an average price of 1,607 rupiah per share between 5 and 7 March 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 3.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, IMR Asia Holding's ownership in FORU fell from 77.33% to 76.81%.
